title: Hashem Beikzadeh
text:
Hashem Beikzadeh (, born January 22, 1984 in <a href="Tehran">Tehran</a>) is a former <a href="Iran">Iran</a>ian <a href="association%20football">football</a> <a href="Defender%20%28association%20football%29">defender</a> and <a href="Coach%20%28sport%29">assistant coach</a> of <a href="Baadraan%20Tehran%20F.C.">Baadraan Tehran F.C.</a>.
Club career.
Beikzadeh is a product of the <a href="F.C.%20Fajr%20Sepasi">Fajr Sepasi</a> youth academy and since his promotion to the first team squad for the <a href="2005%E2%80%9306%20Iran%20Premier%20League">2005/06 season</a> has been one of Fajr's most important and influential players. He moved to <a href="Esteghlal%20F.C.">Esteghlal</a> and won the league in his first season but did not play in many matches. On 8 July 2014, Beikzadeh signed a contract extension with Esteghlal, keeping him at the club until 2016. On 26 July 2015, he joined <a href="Saba%20Qom%20F.C.">Saba Qom</a> after terminating his contract with <a href="Esteghlal%20F.C.">Esteghlal</a>.
Club career statistics.
"<a href="%231">1</a> Statistics Incomplete."
International career.
He debuted for "<a href="Team%20Melli">Team Melli</a>" in August 2006 in a friendly match against <a href="UAE%20national%20football%20team">UAE</a>. Beikzadeh was again called up to the <a href="Iran%20national%20football%20team">Iran national football team</a> for the <a href="West%20Asian%20Football%20Federation%20Championship%202007">West Asian Football Federation Championship 2007</a> held in <a href="Amman">Amman</a>, <a href="Jordan">Jordan</a>. He scored his first goal for Iran on June 24, 2007 in a 2–1 final match win versus <a href="Iraq%20national%20football%20team">Iraq</a>.
He was called for <a href="Team%20Melli">Team Melli</a> again for <a href="2010%20FIFA%20World%20Cup%20Qualifying">2010 FIFA World Cup Qualifying</a>. He played against <a href="Kuwait%20national%20football%20team">Kuwait</a> as a left back. On 1 June 2014, he was called into <a href="Iran%20national%20football%20team">Iran's</a> <a href="2014%20FIFA%20World%20Cup">2014 FIFA World Cup</a> squad by <a href="Carlos%20Queiroz">Carlos Queiroz</a>. He was an unused substitute in the tournament, losing his spot to <a href="Mehrdad%20Pooladi">Mehrdad Pooladi</a> because of injury. He was called into Iran's <a href="2015%20AFC%20Asian%20Cup">2015 AFC Asian Cup</a> squad on 30 December 2014 by <a href="Carlos%20Queiroz">Carlos Queiroz</a>. He was replaced by <a href="Mohammad%20Reza%20Khanzadeh">Mohammad Reza Khanzadeh</a> due to injury days before the first match in Australia.
Personal life.
He is married and has two daughters, Beikzadeh is originally <a href="Iranian%20Azerbaijanis">Iranian Azerbaijani</a> from <a href="Ardabil%20Province">Ardabil Province</a>.
